title: How to Make Flower Essence

methods.name: Collecting Flowers and Preparing the Water

steps.headline: Walk around and look at flowers that are blooming.
steps.description: Since you'll need to pick flowers that are blooming, take a walk around your area to see what's currently growing. Pay attention to the flowers that spark your interest or make you curious about them. You should also pay attention to any other feelings that you're picking up when you look at the flowers. For example, you might feel distanced from some flowers, but attracted to others.

steps.headline: Fill a jar or bowl with 4 to 6 fluid ounces (120 to 180 ml) of water.
steps.description: Take a glass jar or bowl and pour in the fresh water. Use spring water or water from the tap, but avoid using distilled or chlorinated water. If you're using a jar, ensure that the opening is wide so the flowers have access to sunlight.

steps.headline: Pick enough flowers to cover the surface of the water in your bowl.
steps.description: Use scissors to snip the heads from several flowers so they fall into your container of water and cover the surface. The number of flowers you need will depend on the size of the flowers. Try to do this early in the day, so the flowers can be exposed to several hours of sunlight.Did You Know? Some people believe that the flower essence will have better healing properties if you ask the flowers' permission before harvesting them. Choose flowers that haven't been sprayed with pesticides. Some people believe that harvesting the flowers in the moonlight will capture a different type of healing energy that can heal wounds of the past. If you do harvest by moonlight, harvest when the moon is full and the sky is clear.

steps.headline: Leave the bowl in direct sunlight for 3 to 6 hours.
steps.description: Set the bowl with flowers in a place where it will get as much sunlight as possible. Keep in mind that you can make flower essences on cloudy days, but some people believe that you'll receive more energy from the flowers if they're exposed to direct sunlight. If you're making flower essence under the light of the moon, leave the bowl out overnight.

steps.headline: Strain the liquid into a clean jug.
steps.description: Set a piece of cheesecloth or a coffee filter over a clean jug and slowly pour the flower water into it. The cheesecloth or filter will catch the flowers and any particles that could cause the flower essence to spoil. If you strain the liquid into a jar or jug with a pouring spout, it will be easier to transfer to a dropper bottle.

steps.headline: Fill a dropper bottle with equal parts of the flower water and brandy.
steps.description: Set a small funnel over a 2  fl oz (59 ml) dropper bottle and pour 1 fluid ounce (30 ml) of the flower water into it. Then pour in 1 fluid ounce (30 ml) of brandy, which will act as a preservative, and shake the bottle well.Tip: Remember to label the bottle with the flower type and date you made it. For example, write, "Hydrangea, January 2019, Mother Tincture." If you don't want to use brandy, use distilled white vinegar, apple cider vinegar, or vodka.

methods.name: Storing and Using the Flower Essence

steps.headline: Dilute the mother tincture to make a stock essence.
steps.description: In order to use the flower essence, you need to get out another 2  fl oz (59 ml) dropper bottle. Fill the bottle with 1 fluid ounce (30 ml) of the mother tincture and 1 fluid ounce (30 ml) of vinegar or alcohol, such as brandy or vodka. Then seal the bottle and shake it well. You should also label the bottle of stock essence with the type of flower you used and the date.

steps.headline: Put 4 drops of essence under your tongue up to 4 times a day.
steps.description: Shake the bottle of stock essence and remove the dropper. Place 4 drops of flower essence under your tongue and let your mouth absorb it. If you prefer, dissolve the drops in a small glass of water and drink it.Did You Know? Since most flower essences are subtle, it may take several weeks of using the essence before you notice any effects. You can take the flower essence whenever you remember or take it at regular intervals throughout the day.

steps.headline: Avoid taking the flower essence with food.
steps.description: Since digesting food can slow down the effects of the flower essence, you should take the drops on an empty stomach. If you prefer, take the flower essence immediately when you wake up and before you have your first meal of the day.

steps.headline: Store the bottle of flower essence in a cold, dark place.
steps.description: Since the flower essence contains a large amount of vinegar or alcohol, it will keep indefinitely when you store it properly. Keep the bottle at room temperature away from direct light and heat. Storing the flower essence in a dark blue or amber bottle will also protect the essence from spoiling.
